instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> burned wifi area and no backligt - need help identifying parts and ratings
threads.message:
[PLAIN][SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> burned wifi area and no backligt - need help identifying parts and ratings[/PLAIN]

Hi.

This <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> came in totally dead with liquid damage. The wifi chip had been on fire so I pulled it and cleaned the area. After that it starts but obviously wifi is not working at the moment. And it is also missing backlight and I do not think this is related to the affected area, but I don't know as I can not find any schematics for this one...

Can someone help with identifying the missing parts on the pictures? And anyone have knowledge of the backlight circuit in these ones ?

Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> burned wifi area and no backligt - need help identifying parts and ratings
threads.message: You can't get WiFi chips anyway and they are tied to the BIOS I think. Backlight circuit is similar to the 4924 boards, got to trace it out yourself.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> burned wifi area and no backligt - need help identifying parts and ratings
threads.message: Thanks for the hint regarding the 4924 backlight similarities. This is now working. The WiFi thing is just Apple bullshit ...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> burned wifi area and no backligt - need help identifying parts and ratings
threads.message: I believe the MAC address and some other shit is stored inside the WiFi chip. You may get away if you get one from a donor, a new one will probably not work.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> burned wifi area and no backligt - need help identifying parts and ratings
threads.message: Ok. Thanks. I probably leave it like it is. They can use a USB WiFi adapter hanging out as a reminder not keeping any water near by.
